data.title: Movies Filmed on Tybee Island
data.meta_description: Keep reading for a complete list of movies filmed on Tybee Island. How many have you seen? Fly me to the moon, 2024NASA's marketing expert, Kelly Jones, makes life harder for launch director Cole Davis, who's already struggling to put a man on the moon. The White House thinks the mission is too important to fail, so they order Jones to create a fake moon landing as a backup plan. Starring Scarlett Johansson, Channing Tatum, Chris Evans, Woody Harrelson, Ray Romano and Anna Garcia.
data.text:
Keep reading for a complete list of movies filmed on Tybee Island. How many have you seen?

Fly me to the moon, 2024

NASA's marketing expert, Kelly Jones, makes life harder for launch director Cole Davis, who's already struggling to put a man on the moon. The White House thinks the mission is too important to fail, so they order Jones to create a fake moon landing as a backup plan. Starring Scarlett Johansson, Channing Tatum, Chris Evans, Woody Harrelson, Ray Romano and Anna Garcia.

The In Between, 2021

After surviving a car accident that took the life of her boyfriend, a teenage girl believes he's attempting to reconnect with her from the afterworld. Starring Joey King, Kyle Allen and Kim Dickens.

The Girl From Plainville, 2021

Inspired by the true story of Michelle Carter's unprecedented "texting-suicide" case. Explores Carter's relationship with Conrad Roy III and the events that led to his death and, later, her conviction of involuntary manslaughter. Starring Elle Fanning, Chloë Sevigny and Colton Ryan.

The Menu, 2021

In this dark comedy, a young couple has traveled to a remote island to dine at an exclusive restaurant offering shocking menu options. Starring Anya Taylor-Joy, John Leguizamo and Ralph Fiennes.

Devotion, 2021

A pair of U.S. Navy fighter pilots risk their lives during the Korean War and become some of the Navy's most celebrated wingmen.

Harry Haft, 2020

This film is set in post-World War II and stars Ben Foster as Harry Haft, a boxer who fought fellow concentration camp prisoners to survive.

Peanut Butter Falcon, 2019

In this modern-day Mark Twain-style adventure story, Zak, a young boy with Down syndrome, runs away from his care home to make his dream of becoming a wrestler come true. This movie stars Shia LaBeouf, Dakota Johnson and Zack Gottsagen.

Cobra Kai, 2019

Decades after their 1984 All Valley Karate Tournament bout, a middle-aged Daniel LaRusso and Johnny Lawrence find themselves martial-arts rivals again. Starring Ralph Macchio, William Zabka and Xolo Maridueña.

Gemini Man, 2019

An over-the-hill hitman (Will Smith) faces off against a younger clone of himself.

Love Takes Flight, 2019

Old, widowed Walter invites Quinn and her mom, Dr. Lizzie, for tea. There, Lizzie meets his son, Charley, a pilot she's just hired for the hospital.

The Beach House, 2018

The story follows Caretta "Cara" Rutledge, a woman who's tried to move beyond a difficult past but is forced to grapple with history head-on when she returns to fix the family beach house. This movie stars Minka Kelly, Andie MacDowell and Chad Michael Murray.

Galveston, 2018

After escaping a set up, a dying hitman returns to his hometown of Galveston where he plans his revenge. This movie stars Ben Foster, Jeffrey Grover and Christopher Amitrano.

Love at the Shore, 2017

Successful and driven single mom Jenna Thompson writes teen novels, and she has only five weeks to deliver the next one to her publisher. So, this year's annual beach vacation with her kids Nick (Luke Loveless) and Ally (Reagan Shumate), will be a working vacation for Jenna (Amanda Righetti).

Little Mermaid, 2017

A young reporter and his niece discover a beautiful and enchanting creature they believe to be the little mermaid.

Live by Night, 2017

A group of Boston-bred gangsters set up shop in balmy Florida during the Prohibition era, facing off against the competition and the Ku Klux Klan. This movie is directed by and starring Ben Affleck.

Bay Watch, 2017

Devoted lifeguard Mitch Buchannon butts heads with a brash new recruit, as they uncover a criminal plot that threatens the future of the bay. This movie stars Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson, Zac Efron and Alexandra Daddario.

Gifted, 2017

Frank, a single man raising his child prodigy niece Mary, is drawn into a custody battle with his mother.

Untouched, 2017

Under pressure to defend a preacher's daughter accused of murder, a Savannah attorney is forced to face the sin that haunts him.

Dirty Grandpa, 2016

Right before his wedding, an uptight guy (Zac Efron) is tricked into driving his grandfather (Robert De Niro), a lecherous former Army Lieutenant Colonel, to Florida for Spring Break.

The Do Over, 2016

Two down-on-their-luck guys decide to fake their own deaths and start over with new identities, only to find the people they're pretending to be are in even deeper trouble. This movie stars Adam Sandler, David Spade and Paula Patton.

Sinking Sand, 2016

After a loving wife murders a blackmailer to protect her husbands flourishing law career, she must watch as he prosecutes another for her crime.

Christine, 2016

The story of Christine Chubbuck, a 1970s TV reporter struggling with depression and professional frustrations as she tries to advance her career.

Magic Mike XXL, 2015

Three years after Mike (Channing Tatum) bowed out of the stripper life at the top of his game, he and the remaining Kings of Tampa hit the road to Myrtle Beach to put on one last blow-out performance.

The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water, 2015

When a diabolical pirate above the sea steals the secret Krabby Patty formula, SpongeBob and his nemesis Plankton must team up in order to get it back.

The Last Song, 2010

A rebellious girl (Miley Cyrus) is sent to a Southern beach town for the summer to stay with her father. Through their mutual love of music, the estranged duo learn to reconnect.

The Conspirator, 2010

Mary Surratt (Robin Wright) is the lone female charged as a co-conspirator in the assassination trial of Abraham Lincoln. As the whole nation turns against her, she is forced to rely on her reluctant lawyer to uncover the truth and save her life.

The General's Daughter, 1999

When the daughter of a well-known and well-repected base commander (John Travolta) is murdered, an undercover detective is summond to look into the matter and finds a slew of cover-ups at West Point.

Kiss of Fire, 1998

An Italian drifter strikes up a romance with an emotionally troubled young woman, who works as a motel maid/laundress and stripper in a small coastal town in Georgia. Starring Christina Applegate and Stefano Dionisi.

Claudine's Return, 1998

An Italian drifter (Stefano Dionisi) strikes up a romance with an emotionally troubled young woman (Christina Applegate), who works as a motel maid and stripper in a small coastal town in Georgia.

The Gingerbread Man, 1998

A lawyer uses his power to help his lover put her father behind bars, but when he escapes, they are all in danger.

Love Shack, 1997

A romantic comedy that concerns a summer of adjustment as two young people who have been dating for three years suddenly become step-brother and step-sister. Starring Wendy Fill, Sallie Corn and Jamison B. Dowd.

Wild America, 1997

Three brothers who are obsessed with animals are given permission from their parents to travel around America with a camera documenting wildlife.

Camilla, 1994

Vincent and Freda Lopez are a young married Toronto couple. The two drive to Savannah, Georgia for a vacation, where they meet mother and son Camilla and Harold Cara, a former concert violinist and a B-movie producer respectively. Starring Jessica Tandy, Hume Cronyn and Bridget Fonda.

The Judas Project, 1990

This movie is about a modernized 2nd coming of Christ. Instead of facing Romans, there are different obstacles in this modern times that he'd have to face.

The Slayer, 1982

Two couples become stranded on a rugged isle, and are haunted by a supernatural beast, drawn to the wife of one of the couples, who dreams of its killings.

The Ordeal of Dr. Mudd, 1980

Country doctor Samuel Mudd (Dennis Weaver) is unfairly punished by the U.S. Government after he unwisely shelters a wounded John Wilkes Booth during the night after Abraham Lincoln's assassination.

Gator, 1976

Agents force a former con man to help them nab a corrupt politician. Directed and starring Burt Reynolds.

Cape Fear, 1962

A lawyer's family is stalked by a man he once helped put in jail.

Information and images from IMDB.com, Inc.
